verses.verse: so that (2 Cor. 7:4; (1 Thess. 2:19)) we ourselves boast of you among the churches of God (1 Thess. 1:3) for your patience and faith (1 Thess. 2:14) in all your persecutions and tribulations that you endure,
which is (Phil. 1:28) manifest evidence of the righteous judgment of God, that you may be counted worthy of the kingdom of God, (1 Thess. 2:14) for which you also suffer;
(Rev. 6:10) since it is a righteous thing with God to repay with tribulation those who trouble you,
and to give you who are troubled (Rev. 14:13) rest with us when ((1 Thess. 4:16); Jude 14) the Lord Jesus is revealed from heaven with His mighty angels,
in flaming fire taking vengeance on those who do not know God, and on those who do not obey the gospel of our Lord Jesus Christ.
(Phil. 3:19; 1 Thess. 5:3) These shall be punished with everlasting destruction from the presence of the Lord and (Deut. 33:2) from the glory of His power,

when He comes, in that Day, (Matt. 25:31) to be (Is. 49:3; John 17:10; 1 Thess. 2:12) glorified in His saints and to be admired among all those who believe, because our testimony among you was believed.

Therefore we also pray always for you that our God would (Col. 1:12) count you worthy of this calling, and fulfill all the good pleasure of His goodness and (1 Thess. 1:3) the work of faith with power,
((Col. 3:17)) that the name of our Lord Jesus Christ may be glorified in you, and you in Him, according to the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ.
The Great Apostasy Now, brethren, (Mark 13:26; (1 Thess. 4:15-17)) concerning the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ (Matt. 24:31) and our gathering together to Him, we ask you,
(Matt. 24:4) not to be soon shaken in mind or troubled, either by spirit or by word or by letter, as if from us, as though the day of Christ had come.

Let no one deceive you by any means; for that Day will not come (1 Tim. 4:1) unless the falling away comes first, and (Dan. 7:25; 8:25; 11:36; 2 Thess. 2:8; Rev. 13:5) the man of sin is revealed, (John 17:12) the son of perdition,
who opposes and (Is. 14:13, 14; Ezek. 28:2) exalts himself (1 Cor. 8:5) above all that is called God or that is worshiped, so that he sits as God in the temple of God, showing himself that he is God.
Do you not remember that when I was still with you I told you these things?
And now you know what is restraining, that he may be revealed in his own time.
For (1 John 2:18) the mystery of lawlessness is already at work; only He who now restrains will do so until He is taken out of the way.
And then the lawless one will be revealed, (Dan. 7:10) whom the Lord will consume (Is. 11:4; Rev. 2:16; 19:15) with the breath of His mouth and destroy (Heb. 10:27) with the brightness of His coming.
